issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
This was found after the upgrade on an EDGE enabled cloud:

If a security group was created prior to 4.2.0 upgrade and has more than one rules, the GNI file doesn't generate any ingressRules,

{noformat}
  <securityGroups>
    <securityGroup name="sg-43DA5300">
      <ownerId>702261178015</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 1 -t -1:-1  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 6 -p 22-22  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules/>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
    <securityGroup name="sg-58127CAA">
      <ownerId>592529130935</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 6 -p 22-22  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules>
        <rule>
          <protocol>6</protocol>
          <fromPort>22</fromPort>
          <toPort>22</toPort>
          <cidr>0.0.0.0/0</cidr>
        </rule>
      </ingressRules>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
    <securityGroup name="sg-598840BE">
      <ownerId>098152554176</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 6 -p 0-65535  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 1 -t -1:-1  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 17 -p 0-65535  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 6 -p 22-22  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules/>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
{noformat}

Newly created security groups works as expected after the upgrade,

{noformat}
    <securityGroup name="sg-D711E140">
      <ownerId>592529130935</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 1 -t -1:-1  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 6 -p 22-22  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules>
        <rule>
          <protocol>1</protocol>
          <icmpType>-1</icmpType>
          <icmpCode>-1</icmpCode>
          <cidr>0.0.0.0/0</cidr>
        </rule>
        <rule>
          <protocol>6</protocol>
          <fromPort>22</fromPort>
          <toPort>22</toPort>
          <cidr>0.0.0.0/0</cidr>
        </rule>
      </ingressRules>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
{noformat}
fields.summary: GNI file does not add ingressRules during 4.1.x to 4.2.0 upgrade

comments.body: I'm not sure there is any change in 4.2 as far as rules being present in the broadcast. It may be the case that from 4.2 the back end requires the ingress rules in addition to the regular rules. In 4.1 we added a protocol number to rule information (for VPC) that is required for the rule to show up as an ingress rule, the upgrade to 4.2.x should add this information to existing security group rules so older rules are included.

The upgrade task for this would be something like:

https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/b0b3e984900d932f06f5bdcacf592018a01bf897

I don't the GNI file is including any ingressRules after the upgrade. It could be related to EUCA-11791 where CC is not going into enabled state after the upgrade:

{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<network-data>
  <configuration>
    <property name="publicIps">
      <value>10.111.30.116</value>

    </property>
    <property name="enabledCLCIp">
      <value>10.111.1.178</value>
    </property>
    <property name="instanceDNSDomain">
      <value>eucalyptus.internal</value>
    </property>
    <property name="instanceDNSServers">
      <value>10.111.1.178</value>
    </property>
    <property name="clusters">
      <cluster name="PARTI00">
        <subnet name="10.111.0.0">
          <property name="subnet">
            <value>10.111.0.0</value>
          </property>
          <property name="netmask">
            <value>255.255.0.0</value>
          </property>

          </property>
        </subnet>

        <property name="macPrefix">
          <value>d0:0d</value>
        </property>

          <value>10.111.30.122</value>
          <value>10.111.30.123</value>
        </property>
        <property name="nodes">
          <node name="10.111.5.57">
            <instanceIds>
              <value>i-9ce5f9fc</value>
              <value>i-d2638a87</value>
              <value>i-9cd8ed89</value>
            </instanceIds>
          </node>
        </property>
      </cluster>
    </property>
  </configuration>
  <vpcs/>
  <instances>
    <instance name="i-9cd8ed89">
      <ownerId>496625162555</ownerId>
      <macAddress>d0:0d:9c:d8:ed:89</macAddress>

      <privateIp>10.111.30.121</privateIp>

      <publicIp>10.111.30.119</publicIp>
      <privateIp>10.111.30.123</privateIp>
      <networkInterfaces/>
      <securityGroups>
        <value>sg-d5fd24dd</value>
      </securityGroups>
    </instance>
    <instance name="i-d2638a87">
      <ownerId>914656633251</ownerId>
      <macAddress>d0:0d:d2:63:8a:87</macAddress>
      <publicIp>10.111.30.116</publicIp>
      <privateIp>10.111.30.122</privateIp>
      <networkInterfaces/>
      <securityGroups>
        <value>sg-6bfd114c</value>
      </securityGroups>
    </instance>
  </instances>
  <dhcpOptionSets/>
  <internetGateways/>
  <securityGroups>
    <securityGroup name="sg-667a4957">
      <ownerId>496625162555</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 1 -t -1:-1  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules/>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
    <securityGroup name="sg-6bfd114c">
      <ownerId>914656633251</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 6 -p 80-80  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 6 -p 22-22  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules/>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
    <securityGroup name="sg-d5fd24dd">
      <ownerId>496625162555</ownerId>
      <rules>
        <value>-P 6 -p 22-22  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 1 -t -1:-1  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 6 -p 3339-3339  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
        <value>-P 6 -p 80-80  -s 0.0.0.0/0</value>
      </rules>
      <ingressRules/>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
  </securityGroups>
</network-data>
{noformat}

Also, after upgrade, eucanetd cannot find the network mode name in the GNI file.
{noformat}
2015-11-30 23:53:19  WARN | Invalid network mode provided: cannot validate XML
2015-11-30 23:53:19 ERROR | could not validate GNI after XML parse: check network config
2015-11-30 23:53:19 ERROR | could not initialize global network info data structures from XML input
2015-11-30 23:53:19  INFO | eucanetd started
2015-11-30 23:53:19  INFO | update triggered due to file update (//var/lib/eucalyptus/eucanetd_global_network_info.xml)
2015-11-30 23:53:19  WARN | invalid network mode ''
2015-11-30 23:53:19  WARN | Invalid network mode provided: cannot validate XML
2015-11-30 23:53:19 ERROR | could not validate GNI after XML parse: check network config
2015-11-30 23:53:19 ERROR | could not initialize global network info data structures from XML input
2015-11-30 23:53:20  INFO | update triggered due to file update (//var/lib/eucalyptus/eucanetd_global_network_info.xml)
2015-11-30 23:53:20  WARN | invalid network mode ''
2015-11-30 23:53:20  WARN | Invalid network mode provided: cannot validate XML
{noformat}
The network data does not appear to have been written by 4.2.x, please check that the file was written post upgrade.

Awesome! All the ingressRules are populated as expected.

{noformat}
